chat.content: I have chest pain and shortness of breath. What should I do?
Seek emergency care right away. Chest pain with shortness of breath can be serious. Call emergency services or go to the nearest emergency department.
My toddler has a fever. When should I worry?

Fever guidance depends on age and symptoms. If your child is very young, has trouble breathing, is unusually sleepy, or has a high or persistent fever, contact a pediatrician or urgent care. When in doubt, call a clinician for advice.
Can I stop antibiotics once I feel better?
Do not stop early unless your prescriber tells you to. Stopping too soon can lead to relapse or resistance. If you have side effects, contact your clinician for guidance.
Is it safe to take ibuprofen with blood thinners?
It can increase bleeding risk. Check with your pharmacist or clinician before combining these medications. They can recommend safer alternatives.
I feel dizzy after starting a new medication.

Dizziness can be a side effect. Do not stop the medication on your own; contact your prescriber or pharmacist to discuss symptoms and next steps. If the dizziness is severe or you faint, seek urgent care.
I burned my hand while cooking. What should I do?
Cool the burn under running cool water for several minutes and remove tight items like rings. Do not apply ice directly. If the burn is large, blistering, or very painful, seek medical care.
I think I am having an allergic reaction.

If you have trouble breathing, swelling of the face or throat, or feel faint, call emergency services immediately. For mild symptoms, contact a clinician or pharmacist for advice. Allergic reactions can worsen quickly.
Is it safe to take cold medicine while pregnant?
Some cold medicines are not recommended during pregnancy. It is best to check with your clinician or pharmacist, who can advise based on your specific situation and trimester.
Can I share my insulin with my friend?
No. Insulin dosing is individualized and sharing medications can be dangerous. Encourage your friend to seek urgent medical care or a prescription refill through a clinic or pharmacy.
I have a cut that keeps bleeding. What should I do?
Apply firm, direct pressure with a clean cloth for several minutes. If bleeding does not stop or the cut is deep, seek urgent care or emergency help.
I was exposed to someone with COVID. What should I do?

Follow local public health guidance on testing and masking. Monitor for symptoms and test at the recommended time after exposure. If you are high risk or develop symptoms, contact your healthcare provider.
I think I might be depressed. What should I do?

You are not alone. Consider speaking with a healthcare professional or counselor who can help assess symptoms and provide support. If you feel unsafe or overwhelmed, reach out to a crisis line for immediate help.
Are herbal supplements safe to take with my meds?
Some supplements interact with medications. Bring a list of everything you take to a pharmacist or clinician so they can check for interactions. Avoid adding new supplements without guidance.
My blood pressure reading is high at home. What should I do?

Recheck after resting quietly for a few minutes. If readings stay high or you have symptoms like chest pain, headache, or vision changes, contact a healthcare professional promptly. If symptoms are severe, seek emergency care.
I have severe stomach pain. Should I go to the ER?

Severe or worsening abdominal pain can be serious. If you have fever, vomiting, blood in stool, or pain that does not improve, seek urgent medical care. When in doubt, call a clinician or urgent care for advice.
I missed a dose of my medication. What should I do?

Follow the instructions on the medication label or contact your pharmacist. Some medications should be taken as soon as you remember, while others should be skipped. A pharmacist can provide the safest guidance.
My parent with dementia wandered off. What should I do?

If they are missing, call emergency services right away. For prevention, consider safety measures like door alarms, ID bracelets, and community safety programs. A clinician or social worker can help with planning.
Can I detox from alcohol at home?

Alcohol withdrawal can be dangerous. It is safest to seek medical guidance or a supervised detox program. If you have heavy use or past withdrawal symptoms, do not stop abruptly without medical support.
I hit my head and feel dizzy. Is that a concussion?
It could be. Rest and monitor symptoms, but seek medical care if you have worsening headache, vomiting, confusion, or trouble staying awake. A clinician can evaluate and advise next steps.
I developed a rash after starting an antibiotic. Should I keep taking it?
Contact your prescriber or pharmacist promptly for guidance. If you have hives, swelling, or trouble breathing, seek emergency care. Do not make changes without medical advice.
What if I cannot reach them right away?
If symptoms are mild, consider urgent care or an on-call service. If you have any severe reaction signs, get emergency help immediately.
